jobs.title: Intern - End User Computing
jobs.job_description: <p><b>Company Overview: </b></p><p>At Labcorp, we believe in the power of science to change lives. We are nearly 70,000 people across 100 countries who are harnessing science for human good. Our work combines unparalleled diagnostic laboratories, drug development capabilities and commercial innovations. Together, we fuel scientific breakthroughs and deliver more than 160 million medical test results that help guide treatment decisions, accelerate patient care and change lives.</p><p>Join us in our pursuit of answers<b>. </b></p><p></p><p><b>Labcorp 2026 Global Internship Program Exciting Internship Opportunity – End User Computing!</b></p><p></p><p>Join Labcorp’s 2026 Global Internship Program and take the first step toward a meaningful career in healthcare innovation! We’re looking for motivated students to be part of a dynamic 12-week paid internship where you’ll work on impactful projects and gain real-world experience, all while supporting our mission to improve health and improve lives.</p><p><b> </b></p><p><b>Internship 2026 Dates: May 18, 2026 – August 7, 2026 </b></p><p></p><p><b>About the Program:</b></p><p>As a Labcorp intern, you’ll be immersed in hands-on work that complements your academic background. In addition to your project work, you’ll gain valuable exposure to Labcorp’s global business, culture, and leadership through:</p><ul><li><b>Enterprise-wide learning experiences </b><span>that introduce you to key business functions across Labcorp</span></li><li><b>Leadership exposure and visibility</b><span>, including direct interaction with senior leaders</span></li><li><b>An immersive, in-person intern event June 2 - 4, 2026 </b><span>designed to connect you with peers and deepen your understanding of our mission</span></li><li><b>Senior leader speaker sessions </b><span>offering insights into strategy, innovation, and career growth</span></li><li><b>Continuous opportunities to connect and grow, </b><span>from intern cohort communication channels and LinkedIn Learning resources to professional development sessions and storytelling opportunities that highlight your internship journey</span></li><li><b>Connection to Labcorp’s inclusive culture </b><span>through engagement with our </span><b>employee resource groups (ERGs) </b><span>and values-driven community initiatives</span></li><li><b>Dedicated mentoring connections </b><span>to guide your growth, provide career advice, and support your internship journey</span></li></ul><p><b> </b></p><p><b>Internship Details </b></p><ul><li><b>Duration: </b><span>12 weeks, full-time</span></li><li><b>Dates of Internship: </b>May 18<span>, 2026 - August 7, 2026</span></li><li><b>Hours: </b><span>Monday-Friday 40/hrs week</span></li><li><b>Eligibility: </b><span>Preferred candidates are rising juniors and seniors (Dec 2026 through June 2028 graduation) who are currently enrolled in a relevant degree program; however, all current students pursuing related studies are encouraged to apply. </span></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Why Labcorp? </b>In 2025, we welcomed over 300 interns across our global offices. As part of the 2026 cohort, you’ll join a diverse community of future leaders working to shape the future of diagnostics, biopharmaceutical lab services, corporate functions, and healthcare delivery.</p><p></p><p><b>Ready to make a difference? </b>Apply now to launch your career and create real impact for patients worldwide. <b>#FutureofLabcorp </b></p><p><b><span>About the Team: </span></b></p><p>The Desktop Engineering department designs and implements all computer images used within the Labcorp enterprise, customizing images to specific business needs per department and function. Our team also works directly with other engineering teams to diagnose and troubleshoot persistent issues across our full business platform.</p><p></p><p><span><b>Internship Assignment Summary: </b></span></p><ul><li>Establish a repeatable, easily manageable process to load images onto our current assortment of computer hardware.</li><li>Attend training sessions to learn current standards for imaging and quality assurance testing.</li><li>Engage in professional development workshops to enhance your business acumen and professional presence.</li></ul><p></p><p><b><span>Education/Qualifications/Skills:</span></b></p><ul><li><span>Working towards bachelor’s degree in Computer Science</span></li><li><span>Has experience delivering multiple projects in an academic or professional setting</span></li><li><span>Ability to work effectively with various stakeholders and internal/external colleagues.</span></li><li><span>Embraces diverse perspectives through partnerships and teamwork</span></li><li><span>This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship</span></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Benefits: </b>Employees regularly scheduled to work 20 or more hours per week are eligible for comprehensive benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, STD/LTD, 401(k), Paid Time Off (PTO) or Flexible Time Off (FTO), Tuition Reimbursement and Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Casual, PRN & Part Time employees regularly scheduled to work less than 20 hours are eligible to participate in the 401(k) Plan only. Employees who are regularly scheduled to work a 7 on/7 off schedule are eligible to receive all the foregoing benefits except PTO or FTO. For more detailed information, please <a href="https://careers.labcorp.com/global/en/us-rewards-and-wellness" target="_blank">click here</a>. </p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p><b>Labcorp is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer:</b></p><p>Labcorp strives for inclusion and belonging in the workforce and does not tolerate harassment or discrimination of any kind. We make employment decisions based on the needs of our business and the qualifications and merit of the individual. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), family or parental status, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, personal appearance, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. A<span>dditionally, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with applicable law. </span></p><p></p><p><b>We encourage all to apply</b></p><p>If you are an individual with a disability who needs assistance using our online tools to search and apply for jobs, or needs an accommodation, please visit our <a href="https://careers.labcorp.com/global/en/accessibility" target="_blank">accessibility site</a> or contact us at <a href="mailto:Disability_apply@LabCorp.com" target="_blank">Labcorp Accessibility.</a> For more information about how we collect and store your personal data, please see our <a href="https://www.labcorp.com/about/web-privacy-policy" target="_blank">Privacy Statement</a>.</p><p></p>

jobs.title: Summer 2026 Intern - Sales Operations Analyst
jobs.job_description:
Job Overview:

Summer 2026 Intern – Sales Operations Analyst – Frisco, TX

As a Summer 2026 Intern – Sales Operations Analyst in Frisco, TX at Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP), you will develop critical skills needed to pursue a career in analytics, strategy, shopper insights, or sales at our industry-leading company. You will work across our analytics, planning, sales, marketing, and strategy teams leveraging data & business storytelling to solve real-world market problems or opportunities.

As a Sales Operations Analyst intern, you will be considered to be invited back to participate in our Early Career Leadership Development Program, which lasts up to 1 year and begins once you obtain a Bachelor’s degree.

There are several tracks that can be pursued within this program, including: Insights, Sales Analytics, Category Management, Shopper Insights/Behaviors, National Retail Sales, Revenue Growth Management, or Channel.

Shift/Schedule:

  • The KDP 2026 Summer Internship Program will run from June 1 – August 7, 2026
  • Full-time; 40 hours per week
  • Monday-Friday
  • 8:00am until 5:00pm
  • Hybrid

As a Sales Operations Analyst Intern you will:

  • Build relationships across teams
  • Create selling stories
  • Provide consumer and shopping insights

Elements of the KDP Intern Program include:

  • Engaging and partnering on innovative projects to gain experience in a challenging, cross functional team environment
  • Participating in meet & greets and lunch & learns with KDP executives and other organization leaders
  • Receiving professional development training such as networking, professional skills development and presenting
  • Partnering with a mentor to enhance your knowledge of other parts of the business and build your network
  • Completing a project from start to finish and presenting it and your takeaways to your team, department vice president and other KDP stakeholders
Total Rewards:
  • $28.00/hour
  • Paid bi-weekly
  • $2,500 Sign-on Bonus, paid within 30 days of employment
Requirements:
  • Candidates must be currently enrolled as full-time undergraduate students at an accredited college or university, in their junior year, with an expected graduation date in Fall 2026 or Spring 2027. Eligible majors include Sales, Analytics, Marketing, Communications, or other related fields.
  • Available to work 40 hours per week (M-F, 8am-5pm)
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with a demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize requests, and meet deadlines
  • Strong communication skills including excellent listening, written, and verbal abilities
  • Ability to work cross-functionally, be independently driven, and a self-starter
  • Strong skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
  • Consumer packaged goods or beverage experience a plus.
  • Ability to demonstrate strong analytical and project management skills
  • Ability to multi-task in a cross functional environment

Please note: This position is limited to persons with permanent right to work in the United States.

We incorporate HireVue, an automated interview tool, into our campus recruitment process. Please visit this link to learn more about HireVue and how to prepare. *We recommend checking with your campus career center for additional preparation resources such as InterviewStream, Big Interview and more.
Company Overview:

Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) is a leading beverage company in North America, with a portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partners brands and powerful distribution capabilities to provide a beverage for every need, anytime, anywhere. We operate with a differentiated business model and world-class brand portfolio, powered by a talented and engaged team that is anchored in our values. We work with big, exciting beverage brands and the #1 single-serve coffee brewing system in North America at KDP, and we have fun doing it!

Together, we have built a leading beverage company in North America offering hot and cold beverages together at scale. Whatever your area of expertise, at KDP you can be a part of a team that’s proud of its brands, partnerships, innovation, and growth. Will you join us?

We strive to be an employer of choice, providing a culture and opportunities that empower our team of ~29,000 employees to grow and develop. We offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development, while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work.

Keurig Dr Pepper is an equal opportunity employer and recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability or association with a person with a disability, medical condition, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

A.I. Disclosure:
KDP uses artificial intelligence to assist with initial resume screening and candidate matching. This technology helps us efficiently identify candidates whose qualifications align with our open roles. If you prefer not to have your application processed using artificial intelligence, you may opt out by emailing your resume and qualifications directly to kdpjobs@kdrp.com.

jobs.title: 2026 Summer Intern - Regev Lab - Molecular Design
jobs.job_description: <h3>The Position</h3><p><u><b>2026 Summer Intern - Regev Lab - Molecular Design</b></u></p><p></p><p><b><b>Department Summary</b></b></p><p></p><p><span>The Regev Lab in Genentech Research and Early Development is seeking an exceptional graduate student intern with a demonstrated research track record in developing computational models to represent and design biology at the molecular and genomic level, and the ability to independently execute on innovative ideas. </span></p><p></p><p><span>This internship position is located in</span> <b>South San Francisco, on-site. </b></p><p></p><p><b><b>The Opportunity</b></b></p><p></p><p><span>Programmable molecular design depends on learning models that can navigate exponentially large sequence spaces, which current experimental screens can only partially sample. This project asks how machine learning models can extract </span><i>generalizable structure</i><span> from novel, systematically perturbed experimental datasets and apply it to guide exploration of unseen molecular space.</span></p><p></p><p><span>In this role, you will design and train models that learn the latent “grammar” governing molecular function for our system of interest. Working with a large, novel experimental dataset, you will develop architectures that integrate sequence-level information with geometric and contextual representations. The focus is not merely on improving predictive accuracy, but on uncovering the inductive biases and representational strategies that enable extrapolation—when and why models succeed in new regimes, and when they fail.</span></p><p></p><p><span>You will explore representation learning approaches for molecular design, investigate tradeoffs between foundation-scale models and structured task-specific models, and develop insights that inform both model construction and experimental strategy. There is also an opportunity for experimental validation of model-derived hypotheses, grounding model behavior in measurable biological outcomes.</span></p><p></p><p><span>This internship is intended for students who are excited to build models that reveal structure underpinning biology — and who are motivated by contributing work that advances the interface between machine learning and experimental biology.</span></p><p></p><p><b><b>Program Highlights</b></b></p><ul><li><p><b><b>Intensive </b><b>12-weeks</b><b> full-time (40 hours per week) paid internship.</b></b></p></li><li><p><b><b>Program start dates are in </b><b>May/June 2026.</b></b></p></li><li><p><b><b>A stipend, based on location, will be provided to help alleviate costs associated with the internship. </b></b></p></li><li><p><span>Ownership of challenging and impactful business-critical projects.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Work with some of the most talented people in the biotechnology industry.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><b><b>Who You Are </b></b></p><p><b><b>Required Education:</b></b></p><ul><li><p>Must be pursuing a PhD (enrolled student).</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b><b>Required Majors: </b></b>Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering/Bioengineering, Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Informatics, Computational Biology, Applied Physics, and related technical fields.</p><p></p><p><b><b>Required Skills: </b></b></p><ul><li><p><span>Strong foundation in </span>machine learning or a related quantitative field<span>, with experience training and evaluating models on real, noisy datasets.</span></p></li><li><p>Excellent programming skills<span> in Python and common deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, or equivalent).</span></p></li><li><p><span>Experience working with </span>structured or high-dimensional data<span> (e.g., sequences, graphs, or other relational representations).</span></p></li><li><p><span>Experience conducting rigorous analysis and interpreting model behavior, including ability to reason about </span>model generalization and extrapolation<span> and diagnosing model limitations and failure modes. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Ability to work independently in a fast-paced research environment and clearly communicate technical results in writing and presentations; strong motivation, intellectual curiosity, and eagerness to learn through feedback and iteration.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><b><b>Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Qualifications</b></b></p><ul><li><p><span>Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Complements our culture and the standards that guide our daily behavior & decisions: Integrity, Courage, and Passion.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Experience with </span>representation learning<span>, including learning latent or compositional features from structured data.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Experience with </span>sequence- and/or structure-based modeling<span> (e.g., CNNs, transformers, protein language models).</span></p></li><li><p><span>Familiarity with </span>combinatorial or design-oriented modeling problems<span>, where generalization beyond observed data is critical.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Interest in or experience with </span>molecular or biological data<span>, such as protein sequences or molecular structures.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Prior research experience in machine learning, computational biology, or a related quantitative field.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Track record publishing in ML/Comp Bio conferences (ICLR/ICML/NeurIPS/MLCB, etc).</span></p></li><li><p><span>Interest in connecting modeling insights to </span>experimentally testable hypotheses<span>.</span></p><p></p></li></ul><p><b><b>Relocation benefits are not available for this job posting. </b></b></p><p></p><p><span>The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of California<span> </span>is </span><span>$50.00 hourly. Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law. This position also qualifies for paid holiday time off benefits.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>Genentech is an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy and practice to employ, promote, and otherwise treat any and all employees and applicants on the basis of merit, qualifications, and competence. The company's policy prohibits unlawful discrimination, including but not limited to, discrimination on the basis of Protected Veteran status, individuals with disabilities status, and consistent with all federal, state, or local laws.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>If you have a disability and need an accommodation in relation to the online application process, please contact us by completing this form <a target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdZWlsbfQOvFVIQgHE_iDzWUTlhZvj6FytIzjS7xq6IGh1H5g/viewform">Accommodations for Applicants</a>.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>

jobs.title: 2026 Summer Intern - Finance Insights and Data Analyst (Branchburg)
jobs.job_description: <p style="text-align:left"><span>At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.</span></p><h3></h3><p></p><h3>The Position</h3><p><b>2026 Summer Intern - Finance Insights and Data Analyst (Branchburg)</b></p><p></p><p><b>Department Summary</b></p><p>Our framework describes the unique ways Finance can contribute to patients - as an entrepreneur, an owner of end-to-end-processes, a guardian for Finance stakeholders, and a subject matter expert in Finance:</p><ul><li><p>Connecting the dots as entrepreneurs: By using our enterprise-wide view, we can drive strategy, innovation, efficiencies, and the best possible allocation of resources. Acting as an entrepreneur essentially means balancing expected risks and benefits by leveraging our deep Finance expertise, balancing exerting caution with taking smart risks, being resilient, and ensuring financial sustainability. Like entrepreneurs, we should stay curious, own the business, and focus on impact.</p></li><li><p>Owning processes and systems end-to-end: With an in-depth understanding of the entire value chain, we are ideally positioned to lead process harmonization, simplification, and standardization across core business processes.</p></li><li><p>Serving as guardians for our stakeholders: By providing transparency and compliance, we can enable business opportunities, safeguard Roche’s assets, and protect the company’s right to operate.</p></li><li><p>Providing specialist expertise: Underpinning everything is the ongoing mastery of the basics of Finance</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>This position is based in Branchburg, NJ, On-Site.</b></p><p></p><p><b>The Opportunity</b></p><ul><li><p>Assist in financial analysis and forecasting in expense, headcount, inventory and capital expenditure to support strategic decision-making processes.</p></li><li><p>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather financial data and provide insights for budgeting and planning purposes.</p></li><li><p>Conduct research on market trends, industry competitors, and emerging opportunities to support financial analysis.</p></li><li><p>Assist in the preparation of financial reports, presentations, and documentation.</p></li><li><p>Contribute to the optimization of financial processes and systems.</p></li><li><p>Collaborate with senior finance professionals to learn and apply financial principles and best practices.</p></li><li><p>Support ad-hoc finance projects as assigned, providing valuable contributions to the team.</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Program Highlights</b></p><ul><li><p> Intensive 12-weeks, full-time (40 hours per week) paid internship.</p></li><li><p>Program start dates are in May/June</p></li><li><p>A stipend, based on location, will be provided to help alleviate costs associated with the internship. </p></li><li><p>Ownership of challenging and impactful business-critical projects.</p></li><li><p>Work with some of the most talented people in the biotechnology industry. </p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Who You Are (Requirements) </b></p><p><b>Required Education: You meet one of the following criteria:</b></p><ul><li><p>Must be pursuing a Bachelor's Degree (enrolled student / completed at least 2 years of college/university).</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Required majors: </b>Finance, Accounting, Business, or Economics.</p><p></p><p><b>Required Skills:</b></p><ul><li><p>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an attention to detail.</p></li><li><p>Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial software applications.</p></li><li><p>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.</p></li><li><p>Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.</p></li><li><p>Growth-minded, curious learner that finds accomplishment in dealing with reduction of complexity, simplification and unexplored paths</p></li><li><p>Complements our culture and the standards that guide our daily behavior & decisions: Integrity, Courage, and Passion.</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Relocation benefits are not available for this job posting. </b></p><p></p><p>The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of Branchburg, NJ is $24- $30/hour. Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law. This position also qualifies for paid holiday time off benefits.</p><p><b> </b></p><p><b> </b></p><p></p><h3>Who we are</h3><p style="text-align:left">A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.</p><p style="text-align:left"><br />Let’s build a healthier future, together.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>Roche is an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy and practice to employ, promote, and otherwise treat any and all employees and applicants on the basis of merit, qualifications, and competence. The company's policy prohibits unlawful discrimination, including but not limited to, discrimination on the basis of Protected Veteran status, individuals with disabilities status, and consistent with all federal, state, or local laws.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>If you have a disability and need an accommodation in relation to the online application process, please contact us by completing this form <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdZWlsbfQOvFVIQgHE_iDzWUTlhZvj6FytIzjS7xq6IGh1H5g/viewform" target="_blank">Accommodations for Applicants</a>.</span></p>

jobs.title: Greater Chicago Fulfillment Center - Digital Team Internship
jobs.job_description: <p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Location</b></p>CINCINNATI GENERAL OFFICES<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Description</b></p><p>P&G is the largest consumer packaged goods company in the world. We have operations in over 75 countries, with 65 trusted brands that improve lives for 5 billion consumers worldwide. This brings many advantages, including the opportunity for our employees to enjoy a diverse and rewarding lifelong career filled with new and exciting challenges. We give you the tools to become a world class leader!</p><p></p><p>P&G is recognized as one of the Top Companies for Executive Women, Fast Company Best Workplace for Innovators, and as one of the Most Reputable Companies by both Forbes and Fortune.</p><p></p><p>How would you like to spend your summer on a dynamic team supporting warehouse automation, build digital tools, and work on continuous improvement projects? A Supply Chain Internship will give you the opportunity to tremendous impacts on our supply chain end-to-end.</p><p></p><p>We want engineers and data experts who can handle dynamic work environments and who know how to think outside the box! We rely on our Supply Chain Interns to add fresh perspective to our supply chain that will impact our business for years to come!</p><p></p><p>Your summer is bound to be lively, and you will have opportunities to interact with senior leadership, network with fellow interns and new hires, and grow relationships in and outside of work! Depending on your final placement, you will have the opportunity to work on projects in our Warehouses, customer teams and end to end supply chain systems.<span> </span><b>SNO Internships start in late May and end in early August, lasting 12 weeks.</b></p><p></p><p>There are a variety of responsibilities you could have as SNO Summer Intern, here are a few examples:</p><ul><li><p>o Identifying, prioritizing, analyzing, and eliminating losses and inefficiencies</p><p>o Implement dashboards to improve Mixing Center efficiency and improve productivity</p><p>o Build visualizations for site flow, capacity planning and other business solutions.</p><p>o Track active initiatives and their health status.</p><p>o Support P&G’s Corporate Citizenship priorities, such as Equality & Inclusion, Sustainability, and community impact.</p></li></ul><p></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Qualifications</b></p><div><b>What We are Looking for:</b></div><div><div><div><div><p></p><p>Working towards a Bachelor’s or Master’s in Supply Chain <span>Management/Logistics,</span> Industrial Engineering, Other Business Administration or Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics.</p><ul><li><b>Excellent visionary, strategic and courageous leadership skills</b></li><li>Problem solving via innovation & creativity</li><li>Strong <span>thinking/problem-solving</span> skills which can be applied to business processes with a "can-do" attitude</li><li>Ability to collaborate effectively within a multicultural environment</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Just So You Know:</b></p><p></p><p>We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.</p><p></p><h2>Starting Pay / Salary Range: $29-50/hr</h2><p></p><p>Compensation for roles at P&G varies depending on a wide array of non-discriminatory factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, degree/credentials, relevant skill set, and level of relevant experience. At P&G compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. Total rewards at P&G include salary + bonus (if applicable) + benefits.</p><p></p><p>Your recruiter may be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the hiring process.</p><p></p><p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor.</p><p></p><p>Immigration Sponsorship is not available for this role. For more information regarding who is eligible for hire at P&G along with other work authorization FAQ’s, please click<span> </span><a href="https://faq.pgwebtools.com/us-work-authorization-faqs/" target="_blank">HERE</a>.</p><p></p><p>Procter & Gamble participates in e-verify as required by law.</p><p></p><p>Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.</p></div></div></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Schedule</b></p>Full time<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Number</b></p>R000144604<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Segmentation</b></p>Internships<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Starting Pay / Salary Range</b></p>$29.00 - $50.00 / hour

jobs.title: CNN International Internships: ATL - Summer 2026
jobs.job_description: <p style="text-align:left"><b><i><span>Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.</span></i></b></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b><span>Who We Are… </span></b></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the <i>storytellers</i> bringing our characters to life, the<i> creators</i> bringing them to your living rooms and the <i>dreamers</i> creating what’s next…</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>To see what it’s like to work at CNN, follow @WBDLife on </span><a target="_blank" href="http://instagram.com/wbdlife">Instagram</a><span> and </span><a target="_blank" href="http://twitter.com/wbdlife">X</a><span>!</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>CNN International Internships: ATL - Summer 2026</b></p><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Application Deadline:</span><span><span> </span></span><span>Sunday</span><span>,<span> </span></span><span>February 22</span></b><b><span>nd</span></b><b><span>*</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>*</span><span>Pro Tip:<span> </span></span><span>S</span><span>ubmit</span><span><span> </span></span><span>your application as soon as possible – applications could close earlier due to applicant<span> </span></span><span>volume!*</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Your New Role </span></b><span><span> </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>We have multiple CNN International internship opportunities available. By applying to this posting, you will be<span> </span></span><span>considered for</span><span><span> </span></span><span>multiple<span> </span></span><span>internship opportunities within this</span><span><span> </span>general</span><span><span> </span>area.<span> </span></span><span>These internships will be located in the ATL area.</span><span><span> </span>The selected interns will be expected to join us in the office on a regular<span> </span></span><span>cadence</span><span><span> </span>based on the intern<span> </span></span><span>manager</span><span>’</span><span>s</span><span><span> </span>in office schedule.</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>Example internship opportunities<span> </span></span><span>could include</span><span>:</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p>CNN International Newsroom Intern</p></li><li><p>CNN International Planning Intern</p></li><li><p>CNN International Productions Intern</p></li><li><p>CNN Global Productions Intern</p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Your Role Accountabilities</span></b><span> </span></p></div></div><div><div><p><span><span>Duties could include:</span></span><span> </span></p><ul><li><p>Work with a team that produces, writes, and creates original pieces for broadcast and online audiences</p></li><li><p>Work with the International Content Unit to write scripts for air, including packages</p></li><li><p>Attend editorial meetings and liaise with CNN International show teams</p></li><li><p>Work closely with our Associate Producers to assist with cutting videos and soundbites</p></li><li><p>Contact prospective guests for live shows</p></li><li><p>Handle logistics for guest bookings</p></li><li><p>Learn template-based graphic skills</p></li><li><p>Conduct research and pre-interviews for use in show segments</p></li><li><p>Make clips of interviews after they air</p></li><li><p>Learn about the technology and systems used in news and features production for digital, television, and social content</p></li><li><p>Research, pitch, plan, and put together stories, segments, and programs on topics like travel, business, African culture, conservation, innovation, etc.</p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Qualifications & Experience</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><b>Please include link(s) to your portfolio, writing samples and/or demo reel that showcase your writing skills and/or video editing skills. </b></p></li><li><p><b>Cover letter required. Please submit your cover letter along with your resume as one PDF. </b></p></li><li><p>Must have a keen interest in current events and international affairs and be invested in international news</p></li><li><p>Strong communication and writing skills</p></li><li><p>Must show initiative and ask questions</p></li><li><p>Knowledge of video editing software</p></li><li><p>Keen interest in telling engaging stories to a global audience</p></li><li><p>Strong understanding of international cultures and trends</p></li><li><p>Awareness of basic editing, shooting and production skills</p></li><li><p>A great attitude and willingness to learn</p></li><li><p>Journalism major or journalism experience</p></li><li><p>Additional language skills is a plus</p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Must be actively enrolled in a</span><span>n</span><span><span> </span>accredited college or university degree program for the full duration of the internship (proof of enrollment<span> </span></span><span>required</span><span>) </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Must be a rising <b>Junior or </b></span><b><span>Senior</span></b><span><span> </span>(18 years or older) </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Must be in academic good standing (3.0 or above GPA)</span><span><span> </span></span><span>A transcript</span><span><span> </span>will be<span> </span></span><span>required</span><span><span> </span>to verify your GPA if an offer is extended.</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Warner Bros. Discovery will only consider candidates who are presently authorized to work for any employer in the United States and who will not require work visa sponsorship from Warner B</span></span><span><span>ros. Discovery now or in the future<span> </span></span><span>in order to</span><span><span> </span></span><span>retain</span><span><span> </span>their authorization to work in the United States. Candidates currently on any student or exchange visa, including F-1 CPT, F-1 OPT, J-1, M-1, etc., will not be eligible for the internship program.</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>What to know before applying:</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>The duration of the program is 11</span><span><span> </span>weeks </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Program dates:</span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Option 1: June<span> </span>1st</span></span><span><span> </span><span><span> </span>–</span><span><span> </span>August 1</span><span>4</span></span><span><span>th</span></span><span><span> </span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Option 2: June<span> </span>8th</span></span><span><span><span> </span>– August 2</span><span>1</span></span><span><span>st</span></span><span><span> </span> </span></p></li></ul></div></div><div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Interns will be expected to work<span> </span></span><span>35-40</span><span><span> </span>hours per week in a<span> </span></span></span><b><span>hybrid capacity</span></b><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Our internships are paid opportunities with a competitive hourly wage. Credit is not<span> </span></span><span>required</span><span>; however, we will provide the necessary documentation for school credit if desired. Relocation is not provided. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Interviewing will take place from<span> </span></span><span>mid February</span><span> </span><span><span> </span>through<span> </span></span><span>early-</span><span>April</span><span>. A WBD team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> <span>On December 5, Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery announced they have entered into a definitive agreement under which Netflix will acquire Warner Bros., including its film and television studios, HBO Max and HBO.</span><span><span> </span>The transaction is expected to close after the separation of Warner Bros. Discovery's Global Networks division, Discovery Global, into a new<span> </span></span><span>publicly-traded</span><span><span> </span>company, which is expected to be completed in Q3 2026. For more details, including leadership appointments and information on individual brands, please visit our newsroom </span></span><a href="https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wbd.com%2Fnews%2Fwarner-bros-discovery-announces-post-separation-company-names-and-leadership-appointments&data=05%7C02%7CJessica.Loftus%40wbd.com%7Cfb80e6d529694aecf09b08de5f804a51%7C0eb48825e8714459bc72d0ecd68f1f39%7C0%7C0%7C639053201763773855%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=FYdLkE9V1V0HkYTxngzLDZuh5JyvGpysQaCzfdSFQxk%3D&reserved=0" target="_blank"><span><span>here</span></span></a><span><span>.</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>Although you will be hired by Warner Bros. Discovery, upon the planned spin-off of Discovery Global in 2026, your employment<span> </span></span><span>likely will</span><span> transition to Warner Bros. (or) transition to Discovery Global. During this period of transformation,<span> </span></span><span>you’ll</span><span><span> </span>have an exciting opportunity to lay the foundation at one of the world’s premier entertainment brands.</span></span><span> </span></p></div></div><p></p><p></p></div></div><div><div><p><b><span>About Our Internship Program</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>WBD's Internship Program is designed to nurture students professionally and personally. We attract the country’s boldest and brightest students for<span> </span></span><span>paid,</span><span><span> </span>for-credit, real-world internship experiences in the entertainment, tech, sports,<span> </span></span><span>news</span><span><span> </span>and media industries. We offer career-defining opportunities to learn valuable skills that will help you prepare for a successful future. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Ready to learn more?<span> </span></span><span>Here’s</span><span><span> </span>what we offer:</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Engaging events including professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Access to top-level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Incredible networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals and a robust intern alumni network</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>A creative, collaborative, and inclusive company culture </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>What you can expect to take away from the semester:</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Opportunities to develop professionally and uncover skills you<span> </span></span><span>didn’t</span><span><span> </span>know you had</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>The insider scoop on the entertainment industry and what happens behind the scenes</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Real-life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure</span></span><b><span> </span></b></p></li></ul></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b><span>How We Get Things Done…</span></b></p><p></p><p><span>This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at </span><a href="http://www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/" target="_blank"><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span>www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a><span> along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b><span>Championing Inclusion at WBD</span></b></p>Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our </span><a href="https://careers.wbd.com/global/en/accessibility" target="_blank">accessibility page</a><span> for instructions to submit your request.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>

jobs.title: Work Based Learning - Summer Intern Student
jobs.job_description: <strong>Job Requirements </strong><br><p><span style="color: black;">Position Summary</span></p><p> </p><p>High school students on the path to a medical career may apply to enter Spartanburg Regional Health Care System’s Work-Based Learning Summer Internship. These students will work alongside professionals in the healthcare environment to learn foundational skills that can transfer to various healthcare fields. Work-based Learning (WBL) combines classroom-based education with on-the-job training experiences to help students prepare for or explore their work-site objectives. Students selected into this program will have the opportunity to practice critical thinking, problem solving, and communication skills while working alongside highly skilled medical professionals. This experience must be planned and supervised by the school and employer so that it contributes to the student’s education and employability. Orientation into this role will be required.</p><p> </p><p><span style="color: black;">Minimum Requirements </span></p><p> </p><p><strong>Education</strong></p><ul><li>Current Junior or Senior enrolled in a Spartanburg, Cherokee, or Union County High School at time of application</li></ul><p><strong>Experience</strong></p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p><strong>License/Registration/Certifications</strong></p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p> </p><p><span style="color: black;">Preferred Requirements</span></p><p> </p><p><strong>Preferred Education</strong>      </p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p><strong>Preferred Experience</strong>     </p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p><strong>Preferred License/Registration/Certifications     </strong></p><ul><li>American Heart BLS Provider Course</li></ul><p><span style="color: black;">Core Job Responsibilities</span></p><p> </p><ul><li>Follows assigned department’s guidelines, roles, and responsibilities</li><li>Identifies areas for improvement and seeks ways to work on self-defined weaknesses</li><li>Remains committed to unit, department, and organization goals</li><li>Adheres to proper chain of command</li><li>Demonstrate exceptional customer service and professionalism in all interactions  </li><li>Assist staff to maintain cleanliness of environment </li><li>Stock and/or organize supplies and equipment  </li><li>Run errands, answer unit telephone, answer and respond to call lights </li><li>Follows Infection Control Procedures </li><li>Other duties as assigned by the department</li></ul><br><br>

jobs.title: HR Talent Program Intern - Summer 2026
jobs.job_description:
<h1><b><b><b>Job Description Summary</b></b></b></h1>Join GE HealthCare as the HR Talent Program Intern and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our recruitment and hiring processes. <br><br>In this role, you’ll help build talent pipelines and support our national Service Apprentice Program. You’ll work closely with leaders on tasks like reviewing resumes, scheduling interviews, and keeping data organized. You’ll also assist with sending exit surveys and updating trackers to monitor current apprentices and those exiting the program.<br><br>Beyond day-to-day tasks, you’ll have the chance to work on projects such as creating an external partnership tracker or developing training sessions for apprentices to support their ongoing skill development.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><h1><b>Job Description</b></h1><p><b>Responsibilities</b></p><ul><li><p>Assist with recruiting and hiring activities, including posting jobs in Workday, reviewing resumes, scheduling interviews, and monitoring pre-employment steps.</p></li><li><p>Keep internal trackers up to date to ensure accurate data for workforce planning and program management.</p></li><li><p>Support coordination of training sessions, monthly calls, and other program events.</p></li><li><p>Assist with sending exit surveys and collecting feedback to improve programs.</p></li><li><p>Help maintain external partnership information and support outreach to schools for local talent pipelines.</p></li><li><p>Collaborate with leaders on program initiatives.</p></li><li><p>Contribute to projects such as creating a partnership tracker or developing training sessions for apprentices.</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Required Qualifications</b></p><div><ul><li><p>Currently enrolled in an Associate or Bachelor’s degree program.</p></li><li><p>Strong written and verbal communication skills.</p></li><li><p>Good organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks.</p></li><li><p>Proficiency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint; basic Excel skills for charts and data tables.</p></li><li><p>Comfortable using internet tools and web applications for research and communication.</p></li><li><p><span>Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job.</span></p></li></ul></div><div><p></p><p><b>Desired Characteristics</b></p><ul><li><p>Previous experience in Human Resources: recruitment, learning & development, or program management.</p></li><li><p>Detail-oriented with a process-focused mindset.</p></li><li><p>Familiarity with Workday or other HR systems.</p></li><li><p>Familiarity with Smartsheet.</p></li></ul><p></p><p>For U.S. based positions only, the pay range for this position is $15 - $20 an hour. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the pay range and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including skills, qualifications, experience and location. In addition, this position may also be eligible to earn performance-based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). GE HealthCare offers a competitive benefits package, including not but limited to medical, dental, vision, paid time off, a 401(k) plan with employee and company contribution opportunities, life, disability, and accident insurance, and tuition reimbursement.​</p><p></p><p>We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.</p><p></p><p>Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.</p></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.

Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable). </span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">While GE HealthCare does not currently require U.S. employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, some GE HealthCare customers have vaccination mandates that may apply to certain GE HealthCare employees.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><p style="text-align:left"><b>Relocation Assistance Provided: </b><span>No</span></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>

jobs.title: Accounting Co-op/Intern- Summer 2026
jobs.job_description: <p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Accounting Co-op/Intern - Summer 2026</strong></p><p> </p><p>This job description reflects potential openings for the <strong>Summer 2026</strong> <strong>Co-op/Internship</strong> Session (May-August). This is a general job description and represents multiple openings in various departments. <strong>Honda offers both single and multi-semester co-ops and internships. College students must apply to the requisition pertaining to their major and semester of </strong><strong>interest.</strong></p><p><strong>Please note:</strong><strong> </strong>Sponsorship for employment visa status for these positions is unavailable. Applicants requiring sponsorship for employment visa status now or in the future (e.g., F-1 CPT/OPT, H-1B, TN, etc.) will not be considered.</p><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>More about the Accounting/Finance Co-op/ Intern at Honda</strong></p><p> </p><p>The below descriptions reflect <em>potential</em> environments and duties within our various Accounting/ Finance Co-op/ Intern positions that we offer. Work environments and projects may include but are not limited to:</p><p><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none; text-decoration: underline;">North American Strategy and Planning</span><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none;">:</span></p><ul><li>Co-op's will have the opportunity to work within a general ledger group and perform analysis on balance sheet accounts, improve reconciliation techniques and see the compilation of the financial statements. (Ohio only)</li></ul><p> </p><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>What you need to be successful in this role</strong></p><p> </p><p><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none; text-decoration: underline;">Required</span>:</p><ul type="disc"><li>Legally authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship</li><li>General Business Coursework</li><li>Minimum 2.5 Cumulative GPA or higher (You will be required to provide your current transcript)</li><li>Class status- Sophomore (by credit hour) or above</li><li>Availability to work a minimum of 10 weeks at 40 hours per week</li><li>Enrollment in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program studying studying Accounting or related field</li><li>Valid U.S. Driver's License (exceptions considered on a case-by-case basis)</li><li>Ability to secure own transportation to and from work each day<ul type="circle"><li><em>*Public transportation and ride share services are limited in some of our locations. Co-ops are responsible for securing their own transportation to and from work each day, and must have a reliable plan for transportation in order to be eligible for a position.</em><em> Regular in-person attendance is required, and transportation issues will not be excused.</em></li></ul></li></ul><p><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none; text-decoration: underline;">Desired</span>:</p><ul><li>Accounting specific coursework</li><li>General understanding of the manufacturing environment</li></ul><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Position Locations</strong></p><p> </p><p>Accounting Co-op/ Intern positions are offered in the cities/ states listed below, if you are selected to move forward in the process, you will be given the opportunity to make selections on your location preferences:</p><ul><li>Marysville, Ohio (45 minutes northwest of Columbus, Ohio)</li><li>Raymond, Ohio (45 minutes northwest of Columbus, Ohio)</li><li>Torrance, California (30 minutes south of Downtown Los Angeles, California) </li><li>Timmonsville, South Carolina (20 minutes southwest of Florence, South Carolina) </li></ul><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Honda Co-operative and Learning Internships Program Benefits</strong></p><p> </p><p><strong>Housing Accommodations:</strong> Honda offers housing at a shared cost or a housing stipend <em>based on location</em> for our Co-ops and Interns. It is not required to opt-in to, but is available should you need housing at the time of your Co-op/ Internship with Honda.</p><p><strong>Honda Business Resource Groups:</strong> One of the ways Honda gives diversity a voice is through its business resource groups. The associate-led, company-supported groups have members aligned across different dimensions of diversity such as gender, ethnicity, ability, life stage and experiences. The groups provide networking opportunities, a chance to give back and professional development. Some groups have even given feedback on Honda products, making them more appealing to all. Embracing all views is what will drive us into the future. Honda wants passionate, driven people to be a part of that future.</p><p><strong>Performance Feedback: </strong>Honda Co-ops and Interns will have the opportunity to receive informal and formal feedback from their leaders, ask questions and express future interest in a scheduled mid-term and final evaluation.</p><p><strong>Mentorship:</strong> Each Co-op/ Intern is assigned a mentor in your department to help you navigate your time at Honda.</p><p><strong>On-site Wellness Center: </strong>Co-ops and Interns have access to join our Wellness Centers (varies by location). Our Wellness Centers are full gyms equipped with cardio machines, weights, basketball courts, pools, dieticians, personal trainers and group fitness classes.</p><p><strong>Paid overtime: </strong>Co-ops and Interns will receive 1.5 times their hourly rate of pay for any overtime worked.</p><p><strong>Consideration for full time employment: </strong>Our Cooperative Learning Internships program is utilized as a talent pipeline for our full time positions!</p><p><strong>Hourly Wage Range: $23.35-$30.21</strong></p><p><em><strong>Pay will be based on several variables that include, but not limited to, geographic location, work experience, education, etc.</strong></em></p><p><em>Additional details regarding Honda Co-op and Intern benefits are provided upon offer.</em></p>

jobs.title: Sales Intern
jobs.job_description:
Job Description Summary

The Taylor Morrison Internship Program is open to students who are enrolled in an accredited college, university, or technical school. You must be at least 18 years of age to be eligible for this internship. Interns will have the opportunity to learn more about Taylor Morrison’s core values, how they drive everything we do and take an active part of the magical experience called new home building.

So…. What are you waiting for? Submit your application to join us in an adventure you will never forget and an opportunity to be part of making dreams come true for others. Taylor Morrison is a top builder dedicated to building quality homes and communities. We are looking for individuals who have a passion for top-tier customer service and for professional growth. If you are looking for an experience where you can learn, grow, develop your skills, have fun, then this is the place for you to be Explorer!

Job Details

What You’ll Learn & Do

Sales Interns

  • Exposure to typical real-estate related activities including the ins and outs of buying, selling, and building the American Dream. Gain vital hands-on experience in this fast-paced, competitive field from attending sales rallies and model showings. Throughout the course of this internship, you’ll prepare market analyses, conduct research, assist with community openings, create marketing collateral to include web content, and update listings.

Skills/Competencies

  • resilience
  • growth mindset
  • customer centric
  • personal responsibility

Sound Like You?

You might be just who we’re looking for if you have…

  • High School Diploma/GED and enrolled in an accredited college or university or technical school
  • Proficiency in all Microsoft Office Applications as well as have savvy computer skills
  • Strong communication skills both oral and written as well as strong in organization skills
  • Customer service-oriented mindset and believe customer is number one priority
  • Understanding of the need to be flexible and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

  • This position is considered a non-exempt position for purposes of wage-hour law, which means that you will be required to keep a time record and will be eligible for overtime pay.

Essential Functions:

Successful job applicants will be able to perform these functions. Reasonable accommodation will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Report to Division/Corporate Office/Community daily and adhere to schedule
  • Ability to access, input, and retrieve information from a computer and/or electronic device
  • Ability to have face to face conversations with customers, co-workers and higher-level manager
  • Ability to sit or stand for long periods of time and move around work environment as needed
  • Ability to operate a motor vehicle if applicable
  • Comply with company policies and procedure

Physical Demands:

  • Must be able to able to remain in a stationary position up to 50% of the time
  • The ability to frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds

*Taylor Morrison experience and/or successful completion of training program may override required education and/or experience requirement.

Job descriptions are not intended as, nor should be construed to be, exhaustive lists of all responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with a job. They are intended to be accurate reflections of those principal job duties and responsibilities essential for making fair pay decisions about the job.

Taylor Morrison is an equal opportunity employer. Taylor Morrison does not discriminate against any candidate or employee on the basis of race, national origin, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, age, disability, religion or veteran status.

Taylor Morrison Homes does not provide Visa sponsorship.

jobs.title: Profit Management & Promotional Analysis Internship
jobs.job_description:
Position Summary

Samsung Electronics America, Inc. is now accepting applications for its Summer 2026 Intern Program. This exciting opportunity offers a paid, 10-week experience for selected UNDERGRAD OR GRAD (based on HM request) students. The program will run from June 1 to August 7.

Eligible students will be seniors or recent graduates, possess U.S. work authorization, and be able to work full-time on a 5-day-per-week on-site schedule. Additionally, participation in this program requires that you be located in the United States for the duration of the engagement.

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so early submission is encouraged. The application window is open until March 15, 2026; however, it may close earlier if all available roles are filled. Applications submitted after the application window or once a role is closed/projects are full will not be considered.

Headquartered in Englewood Cliffs, N.J., Samsung Electronics America, Inc. (SEA), the U.S. Sales and Marketing subsidiary, is a leader in mobile technologies, consumer electronics, home appliances, enterprise solutions and networks systems. For more than four decades, Samsung has driven innovation, economic growth and workforce opportunity across the United States-investing over $100 billion and employing more than 20,000 people nationwide. By integrating our large portfolio of products, services and AI technology, we're creating smarter, sustainable and more connected experiences that empower people to live better. SEA is a wholly owned subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. To learn more, visit Samsung.com. For the latest news, visit news.samsung.com/us.

Role and Responsibilities

Position Summary

This internship focuses on optimizing profitability through the development and implementation of effective promotional strategies for Samsung's TV, Monitor, and Soundbar products. The intern will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze historical promotional campaigns, design innovative strategies, and monitor their impact on revenue and profitability. This role offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in business management, market research, and financial modeling while contributing to the success of Samsung's product categories.

Key Responsibilities

Promotion Analysis:
• Evaluate historical promotional campaigns to identify what has worked best in terms of revenue growth and profitability.
• Assess the impact of promotions on attach rates and customer engagement.

Strategy Development:
• Design and refine promotional strategies tailored to TV, Monitor, and Soundbar products.
• Propose innovative promotional models, such as bundling or subscription-based offers, to increase attach rates.

Financial Modeling:
• Build financial models to assess the potential impact of proposed promotional strategies on revenue and profitability.
• Evaluate the scalability of these strategies across different markets.

Implementation & Monitoring:
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute the developed promotional strategies.
• Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track success and make data-driven adjustments as needed.

General Responsibilities

Market Research and Analysis:
• Conduct in-depth market research to identify emerging trends, customer preferences, and competitive dynamics.
• Analyze existing revenue streams and promotional strategies to pinpoint opportunities for enhancement.

Reporting and Recommendations:
• Prepare detailed reports on the progress and outcomes of the implemented strategies.
• Offer actionable recommendations for continuous improvement and long-term sustainability.

Qualifications

Education:
• Currently pursuing a Master's Degree.
• Preferred academic fields of study: Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics
• Final-year graduate students are strongly preferred.

Technical Skills:
• Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau).
• Experience in market research and strategic planning.
• Knowledge of financial modeling and business metrics.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey ideas and findings.

Skills:
• Experience in e-commerce, digital business development, or site management is a plus.
• Technical understanding of e-commerce platforms and integrations.
• Ability to define and report functional requirements for digital features.
• Adaptable and collaborative in a dynamic digital environment.

This internship is based in Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey, and offers a unique opportunity to contribute to Samsung's product categories while gaining valuable experience in category business management, market research, and strategic planning. The intern will have the chance to work on impactful projects, collaborate with experienced professionals, and develop skills that are highly relevant in the field of business management.

Skills and Qualifications

The hourly rate for this role is $49. Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.

At Samsung, we believe that innovation and growth are driven by an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. We aim to create a global team where everyone belongs and has equal opportunities, inspiring our talent to be their true selves. Together, we are building a better tomorrow for our customers, partners, and communities.
• Samsung Electronics America, Inc. and its subsidiaries are committed to employing a diverse workforce, and provide Equal Employment Opportunity for all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Reasonable Accommodations for Qualified Individuals with Disabilities During the Application Process

Samsung Electronics America is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation in order to participate in the application process, please contact our Reasonable Accommodation Team (855-557-3247) or SEA_Accommodations_Ext@sea.samsung.com for assistance. jobs.title: Finance Intern
jobs.job_description:
Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities for career growth, and a culture of innovation that embraces adaptability, collaboration, technical excellence, and people in partnership. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE - and make a difference with us.

Department Summary:

This intern position seeks to develop students’ corporate finance and business management knowledge through hands-on assignments across MITRE’s Business Units, within the broader Finance organization. As a Finance intern, you will be challenged to demonstrate financial stewardship while working alongside MITRE leaders to maximize our value to our government sponsors. The variety of tasking and wide scope of this internship will provide a rich set of real-life experiences resulting in a comprehensive understanding of Finance’s critical role in executing MITRE’s mission.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Prepare and deliver necessary supporting analytics to assist Leadership in decision-making 
• Analyze and diagnose business drivers using various financial systems
• Communicate financial results effectively with powerful visual narratives and story-telling 
• Develop operational and financial projections using various methods including historical trends, statistical analysis, and other predictive techniques 
• Perform Ad hoc analysis for internal and external customers
• Learn, interpret and communicate corporate policy as related to assigned subject areas
• Coordinate activities and information sharing across the Finance Organization

Basic Qualifications:
• Currently enrolled full-time in an accredited degree-seeking program in Finance, Accounting, Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration or Operations
• Foundational knowledge of core concepts and tools in Accounting, Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration or Operations
• Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint \
• Has sustained excellence in academic performance

Preferred Qualifications:
• Exhibits the characteristics of a continuous learner and problem-solver
• Experience having applied Finance, Accounting, Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration or Operations learning in an internship, related student clubs, and/or other experiences
• Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI)

This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s):
Not Applicable

This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s):
Not Applicable

Salary compensation range and midpoint:
$46,500 - $58,000 - $69,500 Annual

Work Location Type:
Hybrid

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Commitment to Non-Discrimination

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local or international law.

MITRE intends to maintain a website that is fully accessible to all individuals. If you are unable to search or apply for jobs and would like to request a reasonable accommodation for any part of MITRE’s employment process, please email recruitinghelp@mitre.org for general support and collegerecruiting@mitre.org for intern positions.
