jobs.title: Summer 2026 Engineering Intern
jobs.job_description:
We are DR Power, a Generac Company, professional power equipment done right.

Established in 1985, we are a leader in the design and manufacture of professional-grade gas and battery-powered outdoor power equipment. We are dedicated to the enduring quality and uncompromising performance of everything we build. We stand behind every DR® product and are here to help every customer regardless of when or where they made their initial purchase.

DR Power’s Engineering Intern position is responsible to work with other engineers to fulfill special design requests on our products. Under supervision of engineers, the intern will create definitions of parts and assemblies in the form of 2D cross sections, 3D models, tolerance stack-ups, and various electronic data formats to support analysis, manufacturing, assembly and service. Participants develop technical skills through challenging assignments and usage of technical tools.

This position is based onsite at our South Burlington, VT office.

Job Duties:

  • Designs, validates, and brings new products to market.

  • Provide new product development support in the Industrial, Commercial, Residential and/or Retail outdoor power equipment product area including; Creating and maintaining CAD models, drawings, and BOMs, Supporting product development plans (schedule, product cost, meeting design inputs), Interfacing with internal company personnel, Provide technical support for assigned projects.

  • Specifies precise new product functional requirements; designs, tests and integrates standard, less complex components to produce final designs; and evaluates the design's overall effectiveness, cost (including cost/benefit analysis), reliability (risk analysis), and safety.

  • Designs, develops, executes and evaluates fitness-for-use testing, product specifications and process validation plans for standard products and/or components; creates and reviews material part specifications and bills of materials.

  • Collaborates with internal manufacturing partners, designers and product specialists to optimize basic designs for manufacturability.

  • Utilizes CAD (Computer Aided Design) or CAE (Computer Aided Engineering) systems to model new designs and produce detailed engineering drawings.

  • Supporting product development plans (schedule, product cost, meeting design inputs)

  • Other duties as assigned.

Education, Skills & Experience:

  • Currently pursuing a BS degree (preferably in Mechanical, Electrical, or Industrial Engineering).

  • Available to work Summer 2026 between May and August for 40 hours per week.

  • Understanding or working knowledge of Pro-E and/or AutoCAD experience.

  • Microsoft Office experience (including Excel).

Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision and ability to adjust focus. Occasional travel.

“We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.”

jobs.title: Security Consulting Engineer I (Intern) United States
jobs.job_description: <p>Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today but could open in the near future. When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.</p><p></p><p></p><div><div><p><span><span>Applications are accepted until further notice. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Meet the Team </span></b><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><span><span>Cisco Security Customer Experience (CX) organization supports customers through the entire lifecycle of a security solution: from understanding business needs to deploying custom solutions, from </span><span>optimizing</span><span> existing solutions to developing applications that meets specific needs; from helping customers to </span><span>maintain</span><span> their solution</span></span><span><span>s to helping them investigate poten</span></span><span><span>tial security incidents. As a Security Consulting Engineer Intern, you will be able to interact with customers and learn how Cisco plan, design, deploy and </span><span>optimize</span><span> Security Solution while </span><span>acquiring</span><span> the technical and consultative skills </span><span>required</span><span> to accurately delight Cisco customers. During the internship you will also </span><span>have the opportunity to</span><span> interact with other Cisco organizations and learn how they contribute to </span><span>enable</span><span> our customers to achieve their business goals. </span></span><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Your Impact </span></b><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><span><span>Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more relevant than ever. Our employees have groundbreaking ideas that impact everything imaginable - from entertainment, retail, healthcare, and education, to public and private sectors, smart cities, smart cars, and everyday devices in our homes. Here, that means </span><span>you’ll</span><span> take creative ideas from the drawing board to powerful solutions that have real world impact. </span><span>You’ll</span><span> collaborate with Cisco leaders, partner with expert mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. </span><span>You’ll</span><span> be part of a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and </span><span>you’ll</span><span> </span><span>participate</span><span> in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be inspired. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will attend on-site design and configuration sessions with a Security Consulting mentor </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will collect requirements from customers for projects to meet critical business goals </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will work with a team mentor to define the business goals and requirements for integration efforts </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will aid in analyzing and designing policy creation for Identity Services, Firewalls, Visibility </span><span>Solutions</span><span> and Cloud-based solutions. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will analyze customer configurations and provide feedback on </span><span>possible improvements</span><span> to the configuration to improve alignment with customer business goals </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will learn and understand Security Policies, Standards, Procedures and Guidelines </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will be able to </span><span>demonstrate</span><span> programming languages (Java/Python/C++) and </span><span>open source</span><span> automation platforms (Ansible/Chef/Terraform) to develop tailor-made automation capabilities to customers using Cisco application programming interfaces </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Minimum Qualifications </span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Currently enrolled in a certification program (e.g., Boot Camp, Apprenticeship, Community College</span><span>), or</span><span> currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program. Relevant fields </span><span>include:</span><span> in Information Systems, Cyber Security, Computer Networking, Computer Science or Engineering </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Knowledge of IT systems, networking concepts, TCP/IP protocols, network </span><span>devices</span><span> and applications, OSI 7-layer model, or code development </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Able to legally live and work in the country for which </span><span>you’re</span><span> applying, without visa support or sponsorship </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Preferred Qualifications </span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>A desire and passion for Information Security and willingness to learn and guide yourself tough concepts </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div></div><div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Able to work well in small dynamic teams and balance multiple responsibilities </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>The ability and desire to work on collaborative teams across the US </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Comfortable handling ambiguity and unknowns associated with technical projects </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Self-motivated individual that feels comfortable working on remote teams </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Possess excellent written and verbal skills</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div></div><p></p><h1>Why Cisco? </h1><p>At Cisco, we’re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era – and beyond. We’ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.</p><p>Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you’ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere. </p><p>We are Cisco, and our power starts with you. </p><p></p>

However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.<br><br>Temporary employees generally are not eligible for BAE Systems benefits, but can elect to participate in the 401(k) savings plan. Temporary employees working 20+ hours per week are eligible for medical benefits, the employee assistance program, and business travel accident insurance.<br></br></br><b>About BAE Systems Electronic Systems </b></br>BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve.<br><br>This position will be posted for at least 5 calendar days. The posting will remain active until the position is filled, or a qualified pool of candidates is identified.

jobs.job_description: <p style="text-align:left"><b><i><span>Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.</span></i></b></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b><span>Who We Are… </span></b></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the <i>storytellers</i> bringing our characters to life, the<i> creators</i> bringing them to your living rooms and the <i>dreamers</i> creating what’s next…</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Research & Analytics Internships: ATL - Summer 2026</b></p><p></p><div><div><p><b><span>Application Deadline:</span><span><span> </span></span><span>Sunday</span><span>,<span> </span></span><span>February 22</span></b><b><span>nd</span></b><b><span>*</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span> </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>*</span><span>Pro Tip:<span> </span></span><span>S</span><span>ubmit</span><span><span> </span></span><span>your application as soon as possible – applications could close earlier due to applicant<span> </span></span><span>volume!*</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><u><span>Your New Role</span></u><span> </span></b></p></div><div><p><span><span>Overview of the internships</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>We have multiple </span></span><b>Research & Analytics</b><span><span> internship opportunities available. By applying to this posting, you will be<span> </span></span><span>considered for</span><span><span> </span>multiple internship opportunities within this general area.<span> </span></span><span>These internships will<span> </span></span><span>be located in</span><span><span> </span>the ATL area.</span><span><span> </span>The selected interns will be expected to join us in the office on a regular<span> </span></span><span>cadence</span><span><span> </span>based on the intern<span> </span></span><span>manager’s<span> </span>in office schedule.</span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>Example internship opportunities could include:</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><div><ul><li><p>CNN TV Research & Analytics Intern: ATL - Summer 2026</p></li><li><p>CNN TV Research Forecasting Intern: ATL - Summer 2026</p></li><li><p>CNN TV Research Intern: ATL - Summer 2026</p></li><li><p>Digital Ad Platforms Analyst Intern: ATL - Summer 2026</p></li><li><p>Domestic Distribution Analytics & Insights Intern: ATL or NYC - Summer 2026</p></li></ul></div></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div></div><div><div><p><b><u><span>Your Role Accountabilities</span></u><span> </span></b></p></div><div><p><span><span>Duties could include:</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p>Develop a deep understanding of the tv landscape and media research, and how they intersect.</p></li><li><p>Monitor and run program schedules for Nielson program submission.</p></li><li><p>Efficiently manipulate, analyze, extract and summarize large volumes of multifaceted data using various data analysis and reporting tools.</p></li><li><p>Analyze internal and 3rd-party data to help build market models.</p></li><li><p>Collaborate with team members to define business requirements and core performance metrics.</p></li><li><p>Help test and deploy new advertising products and ad functionality to make sure they meet the required specifications and are free of defects.</p></li><li><p>Conduct exploratory analyses that deepen our understanding of user engagement data across TNT Sports brands and products.</p></li><li><p>Devise, build and maintain reports and dashboards that monitor key metrics for various teams and departments, and the business as a whole.</p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><u><span>Qualifications & Experience</span></u><span> </span></b></p></div><div><p><span><span>Essentials needed for the positions that are similar across the above roles (these do not all have to apply to every single role) </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p>Candidates should be passionate about data & analytics,, emerging technology and trends, and should have the curiosity to explore data, driven to understand the ''why'', and a passion to draw connections</p></li><li><p>Attention to detail and data accuracy</p></li><li><p>Strong interpersonal, writing and communication skills</p></li><li><p>Project and time management skills - ability to be organized and proactive</p></li><li><p>Knowledge in/experience with PivotTables and essential Excel analysis formulas (including IF, VLOOKUP, COUNT, SUMIF)</p></li><li><p>Microsoft Office skills, particularly Excel and PowerPoint</p></li><li><p>Passionate about research methodologies and processes in general.</p></li><li><p>Interest in or experience with Python, SQL, R</p></li><li><p>Preferable Power BI or Tableau reporting knowledge</p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university degree program for the full duration of the internship (proof of enrollment<span> </span></span><span>required</span><span>) </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Must be a rising Junior or rising Senior undergrad student (18 years or older) </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Must be in academic good standing (3.0 or above GPA)</span><span><span> </span>A transcript</span><span><span> </span>will be<span> </span></span><span>required</span><span><span> </span>to verify your GPA if an offer is extended.</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Warner Bros. Television Group</p></li></ul></div></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Your Role Accountabilities</span></b><span> jobs.title: Sports Production and Design Internships: ATL - Summer 2026
jobs.job_description: <p style="text-align:left"><b><i><span>Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.</span></i></b></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b><span>Who We Are… </span></b></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the <i>storytellers</i> bringing our characters to life, the<i> creators</i> bringing them to your living rooms and the <i>dreamers</i> creating what’s next…</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Sports Production and Design Internships: ATL - Summer 2026</b></p><p></p><div><div><p><b><span>Application Deadline:</span><span><span> </span></span><span>Sunday</span><span>,<span> </span></span><span>February 22</span></b><b><span>nd</span></b><b><span>*</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span> </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>*</span><span>Pro Tip:<span> </span></span><span>S</span><span>ubmit</span><span><span> </span></span><span>your application as soon as possible – applications could close earlier due to applicant<span> </span></span><span>volume!*</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><u><span>Your New Role</span></u><span> </span></b></p></div><div><p><span><span>Overview of the internships</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>We have multiple </span></span><b>Sports Production and Design </b><span><span>internship opportunities available. By applying to this posting, you will be<span> </span></span><span>considered for</span><span><span> </span>multiple internship opportunities within this general area.<span> </span></span><span>These internships will<span> </span></span><span>be located in</span><span><span> </span>the ATL area.</span><span><span> </span>The selected interns will be expected to join us in the office on a regular<span> </span></span><span>cadence</span><span><span> </span>based on the intern<span> </span></span><span>manager’s<span> </span>in office schedule.</span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>Example internship opportunities could include:</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><div><ul><li><p>TNT Sports Broadcast Design Intern: ATL - Summer 2026</p></li><li><p>TNT Sports Intern: ATL - Summer 2026</p></li></ul></div></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div></div><div><div><p><b><u><span>Your Role Accountabilities</span></u><span> </span></b></p></div><div><p><span><span>Duties could include:</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p>Observe, train, participate and gain first-hand experience of the production and post production of studio shows</p></li><li><p>Assist with highlight reels & player packages as well as provide content for the ticker</p></li></ul></div><div><p></p><ul><li><p>Compile, edit & log historically team/player reels for MLB, NHL and U.S. Soccer for digital and social platforms</p></li><li><p>Observing, training and participating in the production of live studio telecast.</p></li><li><p>Helping manage the footage library including compiling, evaluating, and logging video for all Turner Sports properties.</p></li><li><p>Gain experience in post-production fundamentals: editing, sound design and visual effects.</p></li><li><p>Cross collaborate with a variety of departments including production, social media, library, marketing, talent services and Creative Sports Services Unit (CSSU)</p></li></ul><span> </span></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><u><span>Qualifications & Experience</span></u><span> </span></b></p></div><div><p><span><span>Essentials needed for the positions that are similar across the above roles (these do not all have to apply to every single role) </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p>Strong knowledge of sports</p></li><li><p>Ability to work in a creative, team-orientated and fast-paced environment</p></li><li><p>Experience working in television production</p></li><li><p>Experience with writing for sports</p></li><li><p>Proactive, creative, enthusiastic and adaptable</p></li><li><p>Editing skills & experience with Adobe Premiere or Final Cut, preferred</p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university degree program for the full duration of the internship (proof of jobs.title: Intern - WEX Bank Compliance
jobs.job_description: <p><b><b>WEX Inc.</b></b> is a global commerce platform that has been simplifying the way businesses operate for over 40 years. Our purpose is simple: to reduce administrative burdens, streamline payments, and manage mobility.</p><p></p><p>With a team of over 7,200 professionals across 16 countries. Our specialties are <b>employee benefits, business payments, and fleet/mobility solutions</b>. We support more than 20 million SaaS accounts, 8 million Health Savings Accounts, and 19+ million vehicles worldwide. We're a growing company with a history of innovation and a focus on our customers, making this a great place to grow your career.</p><p></p><p><b><b>The WEX Summer Internship Program: Learn, Lead, and Make an Impact</b></b><br />Our 13-week paid internship program, running from late May to mid-August, is a chance for you to gain real-world experience and develop your skills. Recruiting begins in January and continues through March at our various locations across the U.S.</p><p></p><p>You won't just be a bystander; you'll work on impactful projects and contribute to WEX’s mission. We provide mentorship, professional development, and weekly learning experiences to help you build confidence and leadership skills. High-performing interns may even get the chance to lead their own initiatives.</p><p></p><p>We offer remote, hybrid, and onsite options for flexibility, and our goal is to bring top interns back full-time or offer them extended roles during the school year. Imagine starting your career with a company that’s building what's next. Your future starts here.</p><p></p><p><b>About the team/role:</b></p><p><span>WEX Bank is a leading provider of financial solutions and payment services. We are committed to providing our customers with exceptional service while maintaining the highest standards of compliance and ethical conduct. We are seeking a Regulatory Compliance Intern. The candidate who assumes this role will be a member of the WEX Bank Compliance Team, reporting to the Chief Compliance Officer. In this role, the team member will focus on supporting the compliance team with various compliance activities. </span></p><p></p><p><b>How you'll make an impact:</b></p><ul><li><p>Support the compliance team execute the Bank's overall compliance program as part of the second line of defense. </p></li><li><p><span>Support the development of compliance resources inclusive of checklists, job aids, training, control documentation, procedures, testing scripts, etc. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Support process mapping, control testing and review and/or assist in the development of first line of defense (the business areas) compliance. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Learn how to assess the level of risk associated with any issues found during testing, following established guidelines. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Help report any findings or issues to the team responsible for managing them, including understanding why the issue happened and suggesting ways to fix it. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Build positive and collaborative relationships with colleagues across WEX, especially those in the business areas and other teams. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Assist in creating compliance reports for the Chief Compliance Officer (CCO), Management Compliance Committee (MCC), Management, and/or the Board. </span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><b><span>Experience you'll bring:</span></b></p><ul><li><p>Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree program, with a focus in Business, Statistics, Analytics, Pre-Law, Finance, or related.</p></li><li><p>Attention to detail.</p></li><li><p><span>Prior banking experience preferred. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Ability to research regulatory changes and analyze their impact.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong communication skills are essential for collaborating with colleagues and communicating with management.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Proficiency in using relevant software and systems is important.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p></p>The base pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position. Actual pay rates will vary and will be based on various factors, such as your qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. Base pay is one component of WEX's total compensation package. Most sales positions are eligible for commission under the terms of an applicable plan. Non-sales roles are typically eligible for a quarterly or annual bonus based on their role and applicable plan. WEX's comprehensive and market competitive benefits are designed to support your personal and professional well-being. Benefits include health, dental and vision insurances, retirement savings plan, paid time off, health savings account, flexible spending accounts, life insurance, disability insurance, tuition reimbursement, and more. For more information, check out the "About Us" section.<p></p><p></p>Pay Range: $20.00 - $25.00

jobs.title: Strategy MBA Intern
jobs.job_description:
Strategy MBA Internship

Jumpstart your strategy career and make a business impact at the largest technology solutions company in the world. Dell Technologies is seeking best-in-class, out-of-the-box thinkers to influence our business and play a key strategic role. It’s an exciting time to make a difference, as Dell emerges as the only provider of integrated, end-to-end solutions from cloud to mobility to big data to security.

Join us as an MBA Strategy Intern on our Client Solutions Group in Austin, Texas to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve

As a Dell MBA Strategy intern, you will own a workstream of a strategic project that allows you to have a real impact on the business from day one. In your role you will work individually and within a project team to take on topics such as evaluating new product / business opportunities and identifying process and operational changes to improve business results.

You will:

  • Perform work aligned with your personal career goals and interests to solve complex problems

  • Develop relevant strategy skills that will help you launch a successful career

  • Join in networking opportunities with fellow MBA interns, alumni, and business leaders

  • Learn more about Dell’s career development and rotational programs that focus on building our top talent pipeline and nurturing future leaders

  • Participate in professional development trainings, community service activities, and various ‘showcase Austin’ social events throughout the summer

This internship will provide visibility into Dell’s broader organization while simultaneously allowing you to focus on a specific business unit that most closely aligns with your skills, interests, and career goals. You’ll have the opportunity to work in one of our Client Solutions areas such as:

  • Go-to-market (GTM) strategy for business units such as Consumer & Small Business, Commercial Sales, and Software & Peripherals (SnP)

  • Product portfolio strategy

  • Digital transformation

  • Innovation strategy

  • Expansion into new markets

Take the first step towards your dream career

Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements

  • MBA Class of 2027

  • Prior work experience in an analytical or strategic role, or equivalent related experience when you join full-time

  • Very strong understanding of business strategies and drivers

Desirable Requirements

  • Demonstrated skills in fact-based analysis, presentation, and interpersonal interaction

  • Expert problem solving and quantitative analytical skills

Compensation

Dell is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this position is $45/hr- $57.50/hr.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.
